headline: Will Optimism on Debt Issuance and IPOs Change S&P Global's (SPGI) Capital Markets Narrative?
summary: An analyst recently reiterated a positive view on S&P Global, arguing the company could benefit from an upswing in debt financing and a busy IPO pipeline amid lower interest rates and strong fourth-quarter 2025 issuance. This reinforces S&P Global’s position as a key beneficiary when capital markets activity accelerates, given its central role in ratings and related services. We’ll now examine how expectations for increased debt issuance shape S&P Global’s investment narrative in light of...

headline: S&P Dow Jones Indices Reports U.S. Common Indicated Dividend Payments Increase of $13.1 Billion in Q4 2025 and $46.4 Billion for 2025
summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices today announced the indicated dividend net changes (increases less decreases) for U.S. domestic common stocks increased $13.1 billion during Q4 2025, compared to the $10.6 billion increase in Q3 2025 and the $11.7 billion increase in Q4 2024. Increases were $16.1 billion in Q4 2025 versus $14.0 billion for Q3 2025 and $14.2 billion in Q4 2024. Decreases for the quarter were $3.0 billion compared to $3.4 billion in Q3 2025 and $2.5 billion in Q4 2024.

content.title: S&P Dow Jones Indices Reports U.S. Common Indicated Dividend Payments Increase of $13.1 Billion in Q4 2025 and $46.4 Billion for 2025

headline: A Look At Installed Building Products’ Valuation After Credit Rating Upgrade And $500 Million Notes Offering
summary: Installed Building Products (IBP) has drawn fresh investor attention after announcing a private offering of US$500 million in senior unsecured notes due 2034, paired with an S&P issuer credit rating upgrade. See our latest analysis for Installed Building Products. The credit rating upgrade and new US$500 million notes offering come after a 13.41% 90 day share price return and a 61.41% 1 year total shareholder return, signaling momentum that extends beyond the latest announcement.
